title: The race to sequence the human genome - Tien Nguyen

multiple-choice.question: What was the estimated cost of the Human Genome Project?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The Human Genome Project used a map-based approach, while Celera used a whole genome shotgun sequencing approach.

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: Both groups completed the sequence simultaneously.

options.label: D
options.text: Neither group was able to complete the sequence.

title: Growth Mindset vs Fixed Mindset: An Introduction

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what do people with a fixed mindset believe about intelligence?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: That it is a fixed trait that cannot be changed

options.label: C
options.text: That it is determined by genetics

options.label: D
options.text: That it is influenced by environment

multiple-choice.question: How do students with a growth mindset approach school differently than students with a fixed mindset?

options.label: A
options.text: They focus on getting good grades to prove their intelligence

options.label: B
options.text: They avoid asking questions to preserve their image

options.label: C
options.text: They focus on learning and developing their intelligence

options.label: D
options.text: They only care about socializing with their peers

options.label: C
options.text: To make friends and have fun

options.label: D
options.text: To get good grades and graduate

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: As a necessary evil to get good grades

options.label: C
options.text: As the way to learn and develop their intelligence

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They give up because they think it means they're not smart

options.label: C
options.text: They ask for help from their teachers

options.label: D
options.text: They try harder to prove themselves

title: How misused modifiers can hurt your writing

multiple-choice.question: What type of modifier is the phrase "with world's largest chocolate bunny" in the sentence "Thief robs town with world's largest chocolate bunny"?

options.label: B
options.text: By rephrasing the sentence to make it clearer what the modifying phrase is talking about

options.label: D
options.text: By changing the order of the words

multiple-choice.question: What is a "dangling modifier" in a sentence?

options.label: A
options.text: A modifier that is clearly linked to the word it is modifying

options.label: B
options.text: A modifier that appears to be modifying nothing at all

options.label: C
options.text: A modifier that is stuck between two things and could refer to either

options.label: D
options.text: A modifier that changes the meaning of a sentence

options.label: A
options.text: A modifier that is clearly linked to the word it is modifying

options.text: A modifier that appears to be modifying nothing at all
